Text: //Movie Play
Alpha dodges the sword with ease.
And yet, that doesn't stop Grease.

He continues to pursue victory, even as none of his
attacks land.
Grease misses by a hairbreadth each time.

Alpha is focused on eliminating unnecessary movements
and calculating the trajectory of his sword to sidestep
oncoming assaults.
After Grease slices through nothing again and again,
he's finally slashed in the chest,
causing him to retreat.

I won't kill you, not until you spill everything you
know...

Grease was only recently informed of this top secret
information.

Information which couldn't—no, shouldn't have been
leaked.

He knows he can't forgive them for getting access to
classified information. But would slaying them
prevent it from spreading?
No, no good.
Which means he needs to live—to survive.
He needs to inform headquarters about the girls.

Grease's body doubles in size—his complexion darkens,
his muscles bulge, his menacing eyes glow red.

And most importantly, his magic capacity increases
dramatically.

Grease's steel sword zings through the air without
warning. Alpha succeeds at blocking it instantly,
but she grimaces on impact.

She uses the momentum to leap back and put
distance between them.
Interesting trick.

Based on the wave frequency, I'm guessing it's a
magical overload...that's been forcibly induced...
Sh...
Shaaahhhhhhh!

There's a rectangular hole in the place where Grease
just stood, leading to a lower level of the facility.
I'll go after him.
That won't be necessary. He's waiting up ahead.

So that's why he split off... Master Shadow's done it
again.

Yeah. I have to admit I was worried he'd get lost
when he sprinted down a different route.
Alpha giggles softly.

Their eyes glow with respect as they peer down the
hole together.
I'm lost.
I got carried away hunting small fry.
I mumble to myself in an empty underground facility.

(It was all fine and well when we infiltrated the
hideout, but I thought I'd go ahead and kill their
boss, which brings us...here.)

(Bummer. I mean, I even practiced what I'd say when I
faced their leader and everything.)

(Anyway, this place is huge. I get the vibe of a
group of bandits living in an abandoned
military facility.)
Hmm?

I sense someone running toward me from the other side
of the tunnel.

It takes a few seconds before the figure notices me,
too, leaving a wide gap between us.

(The guy is super-jacked, and his eyes have a crimson
glow for some reason or another. He looks...really
friggin' cool. I can imagine him shooting laser
beams with his eyes.)
You've been expecting me...
But if it's just you, this should be a breeze.

Then he vanishes—well, technically, darts out of the
field of view at such blazing speed that you would'a
thought he'd disappeared.
But...

(I parry his attack with one hand. As long as I can
spot the course of the attack, I'm not scared by the
velocity of the assault. Even power is all about how
you use it.)
Nnr!

Your magic is incredible—much stronger than Alpha, if
I'm being honest...
But your command over it is dismal, unfortunately.

And, yeah...the way you step into your attacks is
reckless.

(I'm not impressed by a fighter who just gets yoked
with spells, zipping around the room at breakneck
speed with no plan.  However, if we're being honest,
pure physical force isn't quite enough either.)

(Not that I'm trying to reject it. I mean, if I was
being forced to choose between strength and
technique, I'd take strength in a heartbeat.)

(Tactics without the power to back them up are
useless.)

(That said, I absolutely despise half-baked
strategies that solely depend on physical abilities—)

(like power, speed, or reaction time
alone. They overlook and disregard the subtleties of
battle.)

(You see, strength is natural, but mastery requires
effort. Shadowbrokers never lose when it comes to
skill and expertise.)

(My techniques will bolster my strength. My ingenuity
will dictate speed. My reaction time will let me scope
out potential attacks.)

(Physicality is important, but I'd never screw up a
fight by relying on it. That's all part of my battle
aesthetic.)
You don't have an ounce of battle aesthetic.

Haha.  No problem.  I'll teach you a thing or two...
About the right way to use magic!

Lesson one... I take the tiniest quantity of magic
possible, focus it in my feet, and then speed
up all at once.

The sword of my massive opponent slices through the
sky, harmlessly. And now he's in my range.

Lesson two... If you can master distance, you don't
need speed or strength.
Or even magic, for that matter.
(I move forward again, not using magic.)

(His movements are far quicker than mine, but he
can't attack and move at the same time—
No matter his speed.)
(Which is why I can get closer.)
(I take one tiny step.)

(It's a distance that's too long for me and too short
for him.)
(He ultimately chooses to back away.)

(I knew he was going to do that, based on the shift
of magical energy inside him, and I close the
distance before he has a chance to back up.)
Lesson three... I'm just getting started.
(Have I ever felt this overpowered before?)

(Even when he fought Alpha the elf, or when the
princess claimed victory at the Bushin Festival,
he didn't feel this weak.)

(In fact, the last time he'd felt a power imbalance...
Was when he was a child. It was the first time he'd
ever held a sword and squared off with his mentor.)

An adult versus a child, a champion versus a novice.
It could hardly be considered a fight. It's the same
as what he feels right now.

The boy in front of him doesn't look tough at all.
At the very least, he doesn't emit the same
menacing aura that Alpha did when he
fought her.

He's a natural. His stance, magic, and swordsmanship
all seem to come effortlessly. In fact,his strength and
speed are unremarkable—nothing special at all.

But the boy's strategy perfects his swordplay. And he
manages to stand against Grease's powers of mass
destruction with that alone.

Which makes Grease feel an overwhelming sense of
defeat.

He knows the only reason he's alive is because the
boy allows it. If his opponent wanted it, Grease
would be dead in an instant.

But Grease can regenerate his body as long as he
doesn't suffer fatal wounds. Of course, there are
limits and nasty side effects.

Meanwhile, he's shed pails of blood and had his bones
broken, his flesh shredded, which means he'll need
more time to fully recover.
But even in this time of crisis, Grease survives.
No. It's more accurate to say he's been spared.
Why...?
(Why are you letting me live?)
(Why did you attack? Why are you so damn strong?)
(Why?)

Lurk in the darkness and hunt down shadows. That's
the only reason we exist.

There's a distant sadness to his voice. And that's
all it takes for Grease to understand the situation.
Are you going up against them...?

There are certain people in this world who the law
cannot touch. Grease knew this and considered himself
above that threshold.

Special concessions, privileges, and those with
hidden personas. After all, the light of the law
doesn't shine to the very edge of the world.

While Grease enjoyed certain privileges, he was
trampled and crushed by those at the top.

This made him yearn for more power...and led to his
downfall.
Even if you...become stronger...

The darkness of this world...is a deeper abyss than
your wildest dreams!

He says this not to warn the boy but to express his
diabolical hopes.

Grease wishes endless suffering on the boy. For him to
lose everything. To become totally disillusioned, like
what happened to him long ago.

But, overcome with petty envy and spite, he frets
that this wish is out of reach.
Then we dive deeper.

The boy offers this without a hint of eagerness or
ambitiousness. But Grease can sense his steadfast
resolve and unshakable confidence.
It's not that easy.

Utterly unacceptable. After all, Grease is doomed
for failing to take them down himself.

This is the moment he decides to cross the final
frontier, having realized that he will not survive.

If that's the case, he thinks, I'll use this life to
teach him the truth.

I'll teach you the truth...about the darkness of this
world...!!!

He removes pill from his breast pocket and swallows
it whole.
The aura surrounding Grease changes.

Until now, his magical energy had been rampaging
around his body, but it starts to withdraw, replaced
by its densely compressed twin.

His veins rupture and burst with blood, his muscles
tear, his bones shatter—but his body heals instantly.

He defies the physical limitations of a human form
and hosts an immeasurable amount of magical
power. The Cult calls this the "awakening."

Once one assumes this form, there's no turning back.
But in return...one is bestowed with Herculean
strength.
Aaaaghhh!

Too slow! Too flimsy! Too frail! This is reality!
It's your turn to taste it! Taste your own
powerlessness!
